description:
The Whitley Law Firm in Charlotte, North Carolina, is one of nine convenient locations where North Carolinians seriously injured by others' negligence or wrongdoing come from across the state to receive the high-quality legal services that they deserve and to which they are entitled. Our dedicated attorneys make it their goal not only to aggressively seek the maximum compensation possible for our injured clients, but also to treat them with dignity, respect and compassion as we give them one-on-one attention.

We truly believe that our clients are our guests in our offices in Charlotte, Raleigh, Durham, Greensboro, Grenville, Jacksonville, Kingston, New Bern and Winston-Salem. Consequently, our law firm not only provides free initial consultations, but also encourages our clients to schedule as many appointments as they need to discuss their respective cases. In addition, we return all phone calls within 24 hours as a matter of simple courtesy.

Local Values - National Reputation

The Whitley Law Firm's track record of successful recoveries on behalf of our clients speaks for itself. Our experienced trial attorneys are proud to have settled or obtained jury trial verdicts such as the following:

• $5.5 million for a rural mail carrier injured while delivering mail
• $4 million for an iron worker left paralyzed in an on-the-job accident
• $3.5 million for a woman struck by a commercial bus
• $2.3 million for a victim who sustained serious injuries in a bicycle accident
• $2 million for a moped operator who suffered a brain injury

Such recoveries on behalf of our clients have gained us a national reputation. Several of our attorneys have attained the prestigious AV Preeminent* peer rating by Martindale-Hubbell. Some belong to the Multi-Million Dollar Advocates Forum and some have been named among the Top 100 North Carolina Trial Lawyers by The National Trial Lawyers association.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review Rating falls into two categories: legal ability and general ethical standards.
